The Hamshire-Fannett Board of Trustees voted on June 17, 2019 to increase employee compensation. HB 3 requires districts to spend 30% of new state revenue of compensation. Our board opted to spend 86% of HFISD's projected new state revenue on compensation. Some of the factors that make up compensation increases are basic salary increase, an equity adjustment, and longevity increases. Below are the key highlights.

*New hiring salary schedule that starts at $40,000

*Average compensation increase of $4227

*Added annual incentive pay for doctorate, $1,500; master's degree, $1,000; ESL/bilingual certification $500

*Non-teaching employees, such as aides, cafeteria, custodial, etc. $2.00/hour increase

The board did a tremendous job of rewarding employees through compensation. It plans to consider stipend increases and permanent longevity increases for the 2020-2021.

The HF administration wanted the community to know that we will have extra security on campuses for the last 13 days of school. One police officer will monitor the Fannett campuses and one officer will monitor the high school. Sergeant Gilder will still rotate throughout the district as he has since early March.

There is not a known threat; we are just adding security. District officials will continue preparing and completing hardening projects of facilities over the summer. Next school year will begin with many new security efforts. These security efforts will be communicated during the summer at periodic times. The school board continues its commitment to school safety and security. The board has begun discussions regarding concealed carry by trained staff and will continue those discussion at its May meeting and over the summer.

Many families in the Hamshire-Fannett ISD have been displaced because of the Hurricane. The district will provide transportation for our displaced students. Families can utilize the following locations at the provided times:

1.) Students displaced in Beaumont will be picked up in the morning at the Beaumont ISD Thomas Center football stadium at 6:20 AM and will return at 5:00 PM in the afternoon. Please enter the stadium from the Highway 124 entrance. The bus will pick up students on that side of the stadium. In the afternoon students will ride bus 31.

2.) Students displaced in the Nederland, Port Neches, and Port Arthur area will be picked up at 6:50 AM at Central Mall in front of Target and will return to Central Mall at 4:45 PM in the afternoon. In the afternoon students will ride bus 36.

3.) Students displaced in Winnie will be picked up at 7:00 AM at Tractor Supply Company on Highway 124 and will return to Tractor Supply Company at 4:00 PM. In the afternoon students will board the bus displaying the sign that say, "Winnie Shuttle Bus."
